Articles.Content:
I have tried to make a mega huge rocket which shall take our brave kerbinauts to the mun but.. the souyz parts are EXTREMELY unstable, or maybe its the engine parts, either way, when trying to launch the whole thing jumps 3 meter into the air and then collapse.

Edit: If you press spacebar at the right time when it jumps you make a literal 'jumpstart'.

Heavy Struts, for heavy rockets.

Doing this pretty much leaves the only one problem, which is spin ... but with practice you can make the struts correctly.

Speaking of Heavy Struts, why are they a full mass unit each? The normal ones are, what, 0.05? The most the heavy struts should be is maybe .2, and that\'s still a bit high. I changed them after I downloaded, but I think you might want to consider lowering the mass in the DL.

Here\'s a subtle hint.

Top heaviness might go away shortly.

WANT NOAW!!!

Will it fit in a 2m or 3m fairing?

Speaking of Heavy Struts, why are they a full mass unit each? The normal ones are, what, 0.05? The most the heavy struts should be is maybe .2, and that\'s still a bit high. I changed them after I downloaded, but I think you might want to consider lowering the mass in the DL.

1.0 mass units? Jesus christ that must be a typo or something in the CFG. That\'s insane.

Speaking of Heavy Struts, why are they a full mass unit each? The normal ones are, what, 0.05? The most the heavy struts should be is maybe .2, and that\'s still a bit high. I changed them after I downloaded, but I think you might want to consider lowering the mass in the DL.

This is the very reason I made medium struts, which weigh around 0.1.

I did reduce the heavy strut to 0.5, but it may not have made it in.

The reason I have it so high is so it can cover a broader range of use, since jacking up every other value to near infinite levels doesn\'t have the same effect as increasing the weight.

WANT NOAW!!!

Will it fit in a 2m or 3m fairing?

If I recall it fits in the 3m because it just scrapes 2m+ in width.

With the legs, it\'s a shade under 3m.

Here it is compared with a three meter cylinder

i just wanted to say that this is my favorite pack ^^

any chance of you doing fairings and adapters in the different sizes?

One day, when the stars align with the ISS, and Winston looks up at the night sky and screams out 'YYYYEAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRGGGGGGGGGGGGGG'.

This day may soon be approaching.
YYYYEAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRGGGGGGGGGGGGGG

YYYYEAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRGGGGGGGGGGGGGG

We\'ll probably end up doing a few once we finish the moonlander.
Please reduce consumption of the two smallest engines. They have lower Power/consumption then the big ones, which dose not makes sense.

I did just check the Vixen2, and you are right that engine is wrong,a fault on my part.

The Vesta ties it\'s efficiency with the stock motor, but since it is low power I have reduced the consumption a touch more.
I\'ll get a v0.3b version out soon with a few fixes and tweaks, including that.

0.3b bugsie fixie version out, just some minor little things changed, and fixed.

Now for the real eye candy

To the moon in style.
Mmmmhm. Here it is with the ascent stage all explodey.
This is a really amazing pack guys thanks for making it

This is a really amazing pack guys thanks for making it

You are most welcome.

*clicks on frank sinatra*

*clicks launch*

Or alternatively magic carpet ride.
looks amazing cant wait

Do you guys think you could do 4 or maybe 5 meter parts?

I wonder if they would fit on the launchpad. Or even work.

We shall maybe see!
Soon, that won\'t be a problem. It\'s in my plans to make a part that will remove the grief of the launchpad tower AND allow for no rocket size limitations.

Soon, that won\'t be a problem. It\'s in my plans to make a part that will remove the grief of the launchpad tower AND allow for no rocket size limitations.

A very tall decoupler?
Something along those lines, most probably. A very tall, wide and heavy decoupler of some sorts. It\'s only a concept for now.

Do you guys think you could do 4 or maybe 5 meter parts?

I wonder if they would fit on the launchpad. Or even work.

We shall maybe see!

I don\'t think we\'d be making those anytime soon, unless it\'s something unique in those sizes.

It\'s really just a matter of thinking up good ideas as well as expanding on others, at the moment.

The more feedback and ideas, the more things we can expand and develop on.

ps.

The lander will be released in a seperate file. So just incase someone opted out of our main pack, they can get this one independant.

I don\'t think we\'d be making those anytime soon, unless it\'s something unique in those sizes.

It\'s really just a matter of thinking up good ideas as well as expanding on others, at the moment.

The more feedback and ideas, the more things we can expand and develop on.

ps.

The lander will be released in a seperate file. So just incase someone opted out of our main pack, they can get this one independant.

I agree. You would also have to make a crapton of adaptors for it, although a universal 1-2, 2-3, 3-4 type of system may work.

BTW, will you be doing verniers?
